lines.content: Duke is a command line app that allows you to manage and save your tasks quickly and simply!
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/duke/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
1. Navigate to where you downloaded the JAR file from Github.
4. If ticks and crosses are shown as a question mark, right click the top bar of the command line and go to 'properties' and then 'font'. Change the font to a supported font like NSimSun.
Adds a todo type of event into the task list.
Got it! I've added this todo:
Now you have 1 task(s) in your list!
Adds an event type of task into the task list.
Got it! I've added this event:
Now you have 2 task(s) in your list!
Adds a deadline type of task into the task list.
Input: `deadline complete final report /by Saturday 3rd October`
Got it! I've added this deadline:
Now you have 3 task(s) in your list!
Sets a task to be done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Lists out all tasks in the current task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Deletes a task from the task list.
Got it! I've deleted this task:
Now you have 2 task(s) in your list!
Finds a keyword in the description of tasks in the task list.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon! :)
done | Sets a task as done | `done [task number]`
find | Finds a keyword in the task list | `find [keyword]`
* Returns a task number that is parsed from a command that is supposed to have a task number following it.
* @param command The full string of command entered by user.
* Returns an array of strings where the command entered i split into 2.
* @param command The full string of the command entered by the user.
* @return An array of 2 strings, split after the first space bar.
* Returns whether or not Duke should continue to accept the User's commands.
* It is used to make sense of what the user enters and tells Duke which command to do.
* @return A boolean for whether or not Duke should stop running, true means stop running.
* Configures the ArrayList task to set and clear isLoadingFromFile.
* @param pathname String that has the pathname for the data to be retrieved.
* @param tasks TaskList class used when changing isLoadingFromFile.
public void loadDukeMemory(String pathname, TaskList tasks) {
* Retrieves the data from the text file and updates the task list in TaskList.
* @param pathname String that has the pathname for the data to be retrieved.
* @param tasks TaskList class that is used to populate the task list in TaskList.
public void retrieveData(String pathname, TaskList tasks) {

* It prints a loading message if the data directory already exists.
System.out.println("data directory exists and is being loaded!");
* Creates the dukeMemory text file if it doesn't exist.
* It prints a loading message if it exists.
System.out.println("dukeMemory file exists and is being loaded!");

* @param filePath String that has the file path to the text file to write to.
* @param tasks TaskList class used to access the current task list.
public void saveDukeMemory(String filePath, TaskList tasks) {

* Formats the 3 different types of tasks into another format while writing to the file.
* @param currentTask Task class that is being formatted for the dukeMemory text file.
* @return The String that the task has been converted into.
* Converts the text file's contents and adds the tasks into the task list.
* @param fileData Arrays of Strings of each task to be added into the list.
* @param tasks TaskList class used to add tasks into the task list.
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException If some tasks has corrupted fields.
* @throws CorruptedFileException If the task's done status is neither true or false.
public void convertFileToTaskList(ArrayList<String> fileData, TaskList tasks) throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, CorruptedFileException {
throw new CorruptedFileException("Unable to load the file as it was corrupted!");
throw new CorruptedFileException("Unable to load the file as it was corrupted!");
* Constructs a Deadline type of task.
* @param description String containing the description of the task.
* @param by String containing the by timing of the deadline.
* Returns the by timing of the deadline.
* @return String of by timing of the deadline.
* Returns a formatted String that shows the task is a deadline and its description and by timing.
* @return formatted String that shows the task is a deadline, contains description and by timing.
* Constructs an Event type of task.
* @param description String that contains the description of the event.
* @param at String that contains the at timing of the event.
* Returns the at timing of the event task.
* @return String that contains the at timing of the event.
* Returns a formatted String that shows the task is an data.Event and its description and at timing.
* @return formatted String that shows the task is an data.Event, contains description and at timing.
/** Number of tasks in the task list */
* Constructs a task that is not done.
* @param description String containing description of the task.
* Returns the description of the current task.
* @return String containing description of the task.
* Sets the input to the description of the task.
* @param description String containing description to write to the task.
* Returns tick or cross depending if the task is done.
* @return String that represents a tick or cross
* Decreases the number ot tasks by 1.
* Resets the number of tasks to 0.
* Returns if the task is done.
* @return Boolean value depending if the task is done.
* Returns a string message that shows the done status icon of the task and description.
* @return String that shows the done status icon and description of the task.
* @return String that is the type of task.
* Sets if the tasks are being loaded from the txt file.
* @param booleanValue The boolean value to set or clear isLoadingFromFile.
* Returns the current ArrayList of tasks.

* @param taskDetails String input including Todo Description.
System.out.println("Got it! I've added this todo: ");
* Adds a Deadline type of task into the taskList
* @param taskDetails String input including Deadline description and by.
* @throws MissingInformationException If the user did not enter '/by' in a deadline command.
public void addDeadline(String taskDetails) throws MissingInformationException {
throw new MissingInformationException("The deadline 'by' date/time was undetected!");
System.out.println("Got it! I've added this deadline: ");
* Adds a Event type of task into the taskList
* @param taskDetails String input including Event description and at.
* @throws MissingInformationException If the user did not enter '/at' in an event command.
public void addEvent(String taskDetails) throws MissingInformationException{
throw new MissingInformationException("The event 'at' date/time was undetected!");

* Parses what type of task is added and calls the respective functions
* @param taskCommand An array string that includes the task name and its details like description/by/at.
* @throws MissingInformationException If there is no description for the tasks to be added.
public void addTaskToList(String[] taskCommand) throws MissingInformationException {
throw new MissingInformationException("The details of a " + taskCommand[0] + " cannot be empty!");
* @param taskNumber Task number to be set as done.

System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list: ");
System.out.println("There are no tasks that match to '" + keyword + "' in your list!");
* Constructs a Todo type of task
* @param description String containing the description of the task.
* Returns a formatted String that shows the task is a todo and its description.
* @return formatted String that shows the task is a todo, contains description.

System.out.println("Now you have " + Task.getNumberOfTasks() + " task(s) in your list!");
* @param exceptionMessage String of warning message from various exceptions.

System.out.println("What can I do for you?");

System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
